attributes.action: Address the disparity between income support payments made to Couples and Individuals
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: If an two Individuals, sharing a house, each submits a successful claim for Income Support, they are granted a maximum amount of £57.45. If a couple do the same, they are granted the equivalent of £45.05. This disparity does not apply to two private individuals sharing a house; only to those who "share a bed", as a couple. I believe this to be discrimination, based on nothing more than participation of a relationship.
